author: GamingBolt
description:
It’s such a awesome feeling to know you’re in for a masterpiece right from the get-go. Games often take time to grow on us, especially ones with lengthy narratives. 

But there are some lengthy games out there that establish all of its finest qualities right in the first hour of gameplay. Whether it’s a cinematic opener, a clever gameplay tutorial, or a bold narrative swing that defines everything that follows.
title: 15 Games That Made You Say “Oh! This Is Something Special” In The Prologue

author: GamingBolt
description:
There are massive games, and then there are ones that are simply staggering in their size and scope. We're fans of the former, and absolutely love the latter. If you're like us, you're probably looking out for a new title to dedicate your gaming time to. 

And if you know us well, you know that we've got your back. From racing sims, football, adventures, RPGs, and some very unique experiences, there's going to be something you like on the table as we dive into a few titles that had us coming back to them even as other titles came and went by over the years. 

You're going to want clear schedules on some of these gems, as they're bound to have you very invested in what they have to offer.
title: 20 Massive Games You Can Sink 200+ Hours Into

author: GamingBolt
description:
Netmarble Neo said this is separate from Solo Leveling: Arise. This one costs $40, which might as well be a king's ransom for what's on offer. However, they're otherwise the same game. The same combat, the same presentation issues, the same characters – it even has the same Destiny-style hub.

Regardless of whether you enjoy the flashy combat or witnessing certain scenes fully animated, Solo Leveling: Arise Overdrive is just too repetitive, soulless and grindy to really warrant much of your appreciation.
title: Solo Leveling: ARISE OVERDRIVE Review - The Final Verdict
